text: Hi everyone - quick question about page load time speeds → is there a guide about how to solve slow load times and a collection of best practises specifically for HS templates? See this report on a page based on a HubSpot template -> <https://developers.google.com/speed/pagespeed/insights/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pr.co%2Fonline-newsroom&tab=mobile>

Hi,

if you check the first advice of pagespeed it say that you must lazy load images that’s not in viewport

Thanks Guido. The problem is, I can’t control the markup of those images that get output onto the page at the template level, so the task to modify the markup is left up to the editor of the page. But I think your mention of lazy loading has helped me find a solution - so thanks!

(Link here for those of you wondering what the solution could be → <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Share-Your-Work/Lazy-Load-Images-in-the-Rich-Text-Editor-module/td-p/255148>)
On another note can HubSpot provide all the management around multiple versions of an image? Upload original once and HS does all the resampling/resizing accordingly?
I can't seem to group modules this morning :thinking_face: I've tried different templates (existing and new), accounts, browsers, portals... Is this just me?
